content.detail: Among the CD-ROMs I played as a kid, I mastered touch typing from Adventures in Typing with Timon & Pumbaa, created by Disney Interactive. When the Internet became more available, I learned HTML and CSS while playing Neopets. A few years later, I had an internship at the same Disney division that created so many of the computer games I enjoyed. And soon after that, I would be part of a Disney initiative that taught me how to code.

content.detail: My education has specialized in database design, software engineering, and human-computer interaction.

My career thus far has specialized in product management, web development, and software engineering. My professional experience includes work with content management systems and scalable website solutions where I get to collaborate with global colleagues and various brands under The Walt Disney Company.
Outside of work, I enjoy movies, travel, theme parks, hiking, puzzles, and exploring and trying new things wherever I go.
As an advocate of STEM/STEAM, I am open to opportunities where I can encourage and promote tech literacy.
